redeem
redeemUnderlying

nodes.name: _addReserves

nodes.documentation: End Admin Functions

nodes.documentation: End Admin Functions
nodes.name: underlying
exchangeRateCurrent
balanceOfUnderlying

params.account: The account to get the underlying balance of.

balanceOfUnderlying(address).return: The amount of underlying currently owned by the account.

borrow(uint256).details: msg.sender The account to which borrowed funds shall be transferred.

params.borrowAmount: The amount of the underlying asset to be borrowed.

borrow(uint256).return: 0 on success, otherwise an Error code

exchangeRateCurrent().return: The current exchange rate as an unsigned integer, scaled by 1e18.

mint(uint256).details: msg.sender The account which shall supply the asset, and own the minted cTokens.Before supplying an asset, users must first approve the cToken to access their token balance.

params.mintAmount: The amount of the asset to be supplied, in units of the underlying asset.

mint(uint256).return: 0 on success, otherwise an Error code

redeem(uint256).details: msg.sender The account to which redeemed funds shall be transferred.

params.redeemTokens: The number of cTokens to be redeemed.

redeem(uint256).return: 0 on success, otherwise an Error code

redeemUnderlying(uint256).details: msg.sender The account to which redeemed funds shall be transferred.

params.redeemAmount: The amount of underlying to be redeemed.

redeemUnderlying(uint256).return: 0 on success, otherwise an Error code

repayBorrow(uint256).details: msg.sender The account which borrowed the asset, and shall repay the borrow.Before repaying an asset, users must first approve the cToken to access their token balance.

params.repayAmount: The amount of the underlying borrowed asset to be repaid. A value of -1 (i.e. 2^256 - 1) can be used to repay the full amount.

repayBorrow(uint256).return: 0 on success, otherwise an Error code

repayBorrowBehalf(address,uint256).details: msg.sender The account which shall repay the borrow.Before repaying an asset, users must first approve the cToken to access their token balance.

params.borrower: The account which borrowed the asset to be repaid.
params.repayAmount: The amount of the underlying borrowed asset to be repaid. A value of -1 (i.e. 2^256 - 1) can be used to repay the full amount.

repayBorrowBehalf(address,uint256).return: 0 on success, otherwise an Error code

balanceOfUnderlying(address).notice: The user's underlying balance, representing their assets in the protocol, is equal to the user's cToken balance multiplied by the Exchange Rate.

borrow(uint256).notice: The borrow function transfers an asset from the protocol to the user, and creates a borrow balance which begins accumulating interest based on the Borrow Rate for the asset. The amount borrowed must be less than the user's Account Liquidity and the market's available liquidity.

exchangeRateCurrent().notice: Each cToken is convertible into an ever increasing quantity of the underlying asset, as interest accrues in the market. The exchange rate between a cToken and the underlying asset is  equal to: exchangeRate = (getCash() + totalBorrows() - totalReserves()) / totalSupply()

mint(uint256).notice: The mint function transfers an asset into the protocol, which begins accumulating interest based on the current Supply Rate for the asset. The user receives a quantity of cTokens equal to the underlying tokens supplied, divided by the current Exchange Rate.

redeem(uint256).notice: The redeem function converts a specified quantity of cTokens into the underlying asset, and returns them to the user. The amount of underlying tokens received is equal to the quantity of cTokens redeemed, multiplied by the current Exchange Rate. The amount redeemed must be less than the user's Account Liquidity and the market's available liquidity.

redeemUnderlying(uint256).notice: The redeem underlying function converts cTokens into a specified quantity of the underlying asset, and returns them to the user. The amount of cTokens redeemed is equal to the quantity of underlying tokens received, divided by the current Exchange Rate. The amount redeemed must be less than the user's Account Liquidity and the market's available liquidity.

repayBorrow(uint256).notice: The repay function transfers an asset into the protocol, reducing the user's borrow balance.

repayBorrowBehalf(address,uint256).notice: The repay function transfers an asset into the protocol, reducing the target user's borrow balance.
